intro: Phacelia suaveolens var. typica, commonly known as sweet phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It is often used in wildflower gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Its rapid growth and short life cycle make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
